required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Preoperative Psychological Intervention on the Degree of Cooperation During Tracheal Catheter Extubation in Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Preoperative Psychological Intervention on the Degree of Cooperation During Tracheal Catheter Extubation in Patients Under General Anesthesia During Awakening Period

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The patients in the experimental group received the relevant knowledge education in the recovery period 30 minutes before anesthesia. The operation time, anesthesia time, cooperation degree score, total cooperation rate and patient satisfaction were observed and recorded. Results: there was no significant difference in operation time and anesthesia time between the experimental group and the control group (P < 0.05). The percentage of patients in the experimental group was 20.12% and 70.89% respectively, while that in the control group was 40.32% and 20.73% respectively (P < 0.05). The total cooperation rate was 95.00% in the experimental group and 77.00% in the control group. There was significant difference between the two groups (P < 0.05). The satisfaction of patients in the experimental group was 95%. 65% of the patients in the control group were satisfied (P < 0.05). Conclusion: preoperative psychological intervention for patients with general anesthesia and endotracheal intubation can significantly reduce the restlessness and uncooperative phenomenon during extubation, and improve the cooperation rate and satisfaction of patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of half a year
primary_outcome.description: The total cooperation rate was 95.00% in the experimental group and 77.00% in the control group.

arm_group.arm_group_label: the experimental group received psychological intervention
the control group receive normal process before surgery

intervention.description: including closing the relationship between nurse and patient , knowledge education,
intervention.arm_group_label: the experimental group received psychological intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
the patients who will undergo cholecystectomy surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
the patients who can not well communicate

facility.name: 2nd affiliated hospital, school of medicine, Zhejiang University
